results.title: At your service
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the process of the manufacture of ball bearings by the famous Swedish firm of S.K.F. The firm has its own mines and steel works and carries the manufacturing processes right through to the finished product. For commercial uses some 8,000 different types and sizes are produced, in addition special precision ball bearings with an accuracy to 1,000,000 in. are produced for use in precision instruments.

results.title: At whose door
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Basic Films and Max Anderson
results.brief_description: This film deals with the problems of accident prevention in the British iron and steel industry. Demonstrates that accidents do not merely happen- they are caused, not always by one individual or one mistake but by a combination of circumstances which could have been foreseen. Illustrations include: faulty handling of materials or tools, falling or knocking against equipment, untidy workshops, bad stacking or storing, neglect and carelessness.

results.title: At war with the army
results.creator_credit: Fred F Finklehoffe, Screen Associates International and Hal Walker
results.brief_description: One of Hollywood’s greatest comedy duos, Jerry Lewis and Dean Martin star in this screwball comedy about romance, friendship and the military. Martin plays a dejected Romeo, experiencing girlfriend problems and his pal Lewis tries valiantly, but often with comic results, to help out in the love department. Based on the play of the same name by James B Allardice. Also starring Polly Bergen and Mike Kellin.

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 3
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Education Development Center, Quentin Brown and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Center. In this part, work begins on a spacious community igloo. When the men return to their hunt, the women continue with their work and play games with the children. A seal is dragged into the igloo to be shared by everyone including the dogs, who are called in to clean up. (Award: Parno)

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Education Development Center, Quentin Brown and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. This film show life at the campsite. Children amuse themselves with makeshift toys. Women tend their children, make clothes, and repair the igloos. When the men return with their catch, everyone goes inside where work, story-telling and games occupy each one’s time. Award: Parno. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Education Development Center, Quentin Brown and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. In late winter when the cold is severe, the inuit stop their trek and make camp. The men cut blocks for an igloo while the women shovel the site. During the day, the men sit patiently on the ice, waiting for seals. (Award: Parno)

results.title: At the turn of the age: Hans Holbein the younger 1497-1543
results.creator_credit: Walter Leckebusch, Filmstudio Walter Leckebusch and Herbert E. Meyer
results.brief_description: Deals with aspects of the Renaissance and concentrates on the development of Holbein’s painting, drawing and etching. Holbein, a court painter, and a prime example of the new breed of man who could move out of the restrictive boundaries of his homeland to achieve fame and wealth in foreign courts and cities.
results.title_for_label: At the turn of the age: Hans Holbein the younger 1497-1543

results.title: At the threshold of eternity
results.creator_credit: Mikel Way and Colorado State University Production Company
results.brief_description: Dr. James Enderson talks about the ways being used to save endangered or threatened wildlife. The following recovery plans: Habitat Management, Transplanting, and Captive Breeding, are shown in practice with wildlife in several areas of the United States.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mikel Way and Colorado State University Production Company

results.title: At the threshold
results.creator_credit: Michael Grant, Richard Meech and Biniman Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Millennium: tribal wisdom and the modern world”.
Has the pursuit of self interest that has driven our society since the 12th Century finally run its course? Explore this possibility in the series finale. Return with David Maybury-Lewis to tribes all over the world to review the primary wisdom’s that tribal people offer to our modernised world. Then travel to central France to explore the most perplexing dilemmas of the western world. heart versus mind, body versus soul, the desires of the individual versus the needs of society. Visit a rural French family whose lifestyle exhibits the positive influences that have been inherited from a tribal past. Understand why our survival as a species may now depend on rediscovering the wisdom’s of our tribal past.
